original:
In 1873, American railroad tycoons Henry Meiggs and his nephew, Minor C. Keith, established banana plantations along the railroads they constructed in Costa Rica to provide food for their workers. Recognizing the profitability of banana exports, they began shipping the fruit to the Southeastern United States. 

In the mid-1870s, to oversee this new agricultural enterprise in Central America, Keith founded the Tropical Trading and Transp
